title: Advancing Community Engaged Approaches to Identifying Structural Drivers of Racial Bias in Health Diagnostic Algorithms. (arXiv:2305.13485v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Much attention and concern has been raised recently about bias and the use of machine learning algorithms in healthcare, especially as it relates to perpetuating racial discrimination and health disparities. Following an initial system dynamics workshop at the Data for Black Lives II conference hosted at MIT in January of 2019, a group of conference participants interested in building capabilities to use system dynamics to understand complex societal issues convened monthly to explore issues related to racial bias in AI and implications for health disparities through qualitative and simulation modeling. In this paper we present results and insights from the modeling process and highlight the importance of centering the discussion of data and healthcare on people and their experiences with healthcare and science, and recognizing the societal context where the algorithm is operating. translated_title: 推进社区参与方法以识别健康诊断算法中的种族偏见的结构驱动因素
translated_abstract: 最近，机器学习算法在医疗保健中的使用引起了人们的关注和担忧，特别是在持续种族歧视和健康差距方面。在2019年1月举办的Data for Black Lives II会议上的初始系统动力学研讨会后，一群对使用系统动力学来理解复杂社会问题感兴趣的会议参与者每月聚集一次，探讨与AI的种族偏见以及对健康差距的影响有关的问题，通过定性和模拟建模来展示建模过程中的结果和见解。本文重点介绍了围绕数据和医疗保健的讨论围绕人们及其与医疗保健和科学的经验以及识别算法运行的社会背景的重要性。通过负面经验和社区创伤的集体记忆，导致死亡归因于医疗保健不良。
tldr: 本文通过定性和模拟建模，强调了将数据和医疗保健事务的讨论置于人们以及他们在医疗保健和科学方面的经验和认识，并认识到算法运行所处的社会背景的重要性，以帮助理解和解决机器学习算法在医疗保健中所导致的种族歧视和健康差距的问题。
en_tdlr: This paper highlights the importance of centering the discussion of data and healthcare on people and their experiences with healthcare and science, recognizing the societal context where the algorithm is operating, aiming to address racial bias and health disparities caused by machine learning algorithms in healthcare through qualitative and simulation modeling.
